newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Speedy BA-American decision possible-EU sources.
newsitem.headline: Speedy BA-American decision possible-EU sources.

text.p: European Union competition sources said on Friday they hoped to get a speedy decision on the proposed alliance between British Airways and AMR's American Airlines but they still had serious concerns about the deal.

Noting that the alliance had already waited for a year for regulatory approval in Britain, the United States and the EU, the sources added that they were optimistic negotiations were now gaining pace.
The Commission insisted the two airlines had to surrender landing and take-off slots at London Heathrow airport and this was a serious problem, the sources said.
A final decision was expected to be taken before the Commission's August break, or even more quickly depending on the parties' willingness to make concessions. There is no deadline for a ruling.

European Competition Commissioner Karel Van Miert met British Trade and Industry Secretary Margaret Beckett earlier this week to inform her of the Commission's concerns and to ask for her full cooperation in the examination of the case.

The authorisation process was likely to take longer in the U.S., because the Department of Justice, which must advise the Department of Transport on the case, has decided to organise a public hearing around mid-June, the sources said.
